sense.name: Corrupt someone morally through intemperance or sensuality; cause to go astray.
sense.examples: School counselors are often seen to pervert the students in their care. Parents can pervert their children in the rudest of ways.

sense.name: Change the meaning of (someone's) words with intent to deceive.
sense.examples: Don't pervert my words, Sir Henry! The media perverted the candidate's message.

sense.name: Change the purpose or functioning of a system.
sense.examples: Don't pervert the judicial system. The director of the factory perverted the formerly clean finances passed down from the recently retired CFO.
